bioghist.p: Charles H. Hamrick (1827-1902) lived in Philadelphia all of his life. He and his wife, Matilda Bower, had five children. Hamrick owned two jewelry stores.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of photographs. The subjects of family photographs include Laura Hamrick Biddle, Charles Hamrick, William Hamrick, Winfield Hamrick, Charles and Oliver Hamrick, Sarah Bartholomeau, and other family and friends. Most are from the 19th century. The collection also includes mid- to late 20th century photographs of Philadelphia scenes, like the Delaware and Schuykill Rivers and the Museum of Art (many unidentified). There is also a small amount of correspondence to Laura Biddle, 1888-1892.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
